body:
As a lot of people already know I play on a laptop, a really sucky one that is. And well today my brother was taking a bath and took my laptop with him, to do work. And then we'll you can guess...  
The ironic part is, is that today is birthday.
Happy Birthday to me
And now imma get a better laptop any suggestions on wich laptop I should get next, just remember maximum price is about $500 maybe a little higher. Any ideas, guys/girls?

Due to this, I don't have access to games nor any programs associated to computers.

title: Computer suggestions please!

Centrecom (AU)
Digitalstar (AU)
OriginPC (US & CA)

Well... I'm going to go ahead and recommend an iMac.
Despite the contrary, the iMac I use is very good for gaming, editing, writing, and overall looks. It's smooth, user friendly and runs smoothly. If you want me to explain any more, go ahead and reply to this comment :3

replies.body:
Saying they aren't good for a gaming is a common mis-conception. 
The real truth is the following:- 

1. They are ridiculously expensive. This guy's budget it $500. The only way you're going to get any Mac OS X product for $500 would be one for 3-4+ years ago which'll likely have horrible specs all round.

2. On top of being ridiculously expensive, for that expense, you are not paying for any extra power spec wise. The cheapest base-line iMac being 1.4GHz Dual-Core i5.

Emphasis on 1.4Ghz and DUAL-core

Base-line iMac also having the integrated graphics of last years' macbook airs as well.

So yeah, they're beautiful computers and I'm in love with apple. But no, they aren't worth the investment if you can't afford it. 

NOW BACK TO MY GOD-FORSAKEN ASSIGNMENT, WHICH I WAS WRITING AND AM NOW PROCRASTINATING BY WRITING ESSAYS ON THIS DAMN FORUM.
